## Expectation.toEqual() method

Performs a recursive equality check. Objects are equal if their fields are equal and they share the same prototype.

You can use matchers in place of a value. When a matcher is encountered its internal rules are used instead of the usual checks.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
toEqual(value: T): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  value | T | value to check against. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
